item.title: Kathie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kathie add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Kathie add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Kathie add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Kathie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kathie add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "You're not to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or says it." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Kathie add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "What difference does it make to the dead, the orphans and the homeless, whether the mad destruction is wrought under the name of totalitarianism or in the holy name of liberty or democracy?" -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kathie add a quote by Dwight D. Eisenhower
item.description: "Every gun that is made, every warship launched, every rocket fired signifies in the final sense, a theft from those who hunger and are not fed, those who are cold and are not clothed. This world in arms is not spending money alone. It is spending the sweat of its laborers, the genius of its scientists, the hopes of its children. This is not a way of life at all in any true sense. Under the clouds of war, it is humanity hanging on a cross of iron." -- Dwight D. Eisenhower

item.title: Kathie add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "I think it's perfectly possible to explain how the universe came about without bringing God into it, but I don't know everything, and there may well be a God somewhere, hiding away. Actually, if he is keeping out of sight, it's because he's ashamed of his followers and all the cruelty and ignorance they're responsible for promoting in his name. If I were him, I'd want nothing to do with them." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Kathie add a quote by Nicolas Chamfort
item.description: "A day without laughter is a day wasted." -- Nicolas Chamfort

item.title: Kathie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kathie add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "I'm completely in favor of the separation of Church and State. ... These two institutions screw us up enough on their own, so both of them together is certain death." -- George Carlin

item.title: Kathie add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Fighting for peace is like screwing for virginity." -- George Carlin

item.title: Kathie add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "I do this real moron thing, and it's called thinking. And apparently I'm not a very good American because I like to form my own opinions." -- George Carlin

item.title: Kathie add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Don't sweat the petty things and don't pet the sweaty things." -- George Carlin

item.title: Kathie add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Laugh often, long and loud. Laugh until you gasp for breath." -- George Carlin

item.title: Kathie add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.
